Absolute Transcendence.quote: Beyond all thought, beyond all qualities, beyond all definition dwells the Absolute. (Upanishads)

Supreme Being.quote: I am the Supreme Brahman, the eternal, the pure, the free, the one, and the infinite. (Vivekachudamani)

Personal God.quote: The LORD is my shepherd, I shall not want. (Psalm 23:1)

Creator God.quote: In the beginning God created the heavens and the earth. (Genesis 1:1)

Universal Consciousness.quote: That which pervades all, which nothing transcends and which, like the universal space around us, fills everything completely from within and without. (Bhagavad Gita)

Divine Intelligence.quote: The Logos was with God, and the Logos was God. (John 1:1)

Cosmic Mind.quote: The universal mind contains all knowledge. It is the potential ultimate of all things. (The Kybalion)

Manifested Deity.quote: I manifest myself in various forms, yet remain unchanged. (Krishna, Bhagavad Gita)

Divine Emanations.quote: From the One come the many, like sparks from a fire. (Plotinus, Enneads)

Avatars.quote: Whenever dharma declines and adharma increases, I incarnate myself. (Bhagavad Gita 4:7)

Divine Attributes.quote: To God belong the most beautiful names. (Quran 7:180)

Angelic Hierarchy.quote: Above him were seraphim, each with six wings. (Isaiah 6:2)

Divine Powers.quote: All power in heaven and on earth has been given to me. (Matthew 28:18)

Lesser Deities.quote: There are many gods and many lords, yet for us there is but one God. (1 Corinthians 8:5-6)

Nature Spirits.quote: Every tree, every spring, every stream, every hill had its own genius loci, its guardian spirit. (Plutarch)

Divine Messengers.quote: We sent not a messenger except to teach the native language of his people. (Quran 14:4)

Divine Essence.quote: The essence of all beings is the divine; know this and rejoice in it. (Upanishads)

Cosmic Forces.quote: The divine forces maintain the cosmic order through their eternal dance. (Vedic Texts)

Divine Light.quote: God is light; in him there is no darkness at all. (1 John 1:5)

Divine Love.quote: God is love. Whoever lives in love lives in God, and God in them. (1 John 4:16)

Divine Wisdom.quote: Wisdom was with God in the beginning, before any of his works. (Proverbs 8:22)

Divine Truth.quote: The truth is one, though sages know it by many names. (Rig Veda)

Divine Justice.quote: Righteousness and justice are the foundation of your throne. (Psalm 89:14)

Divine Beauty.quote: One thing I ask from the LORD: to gaze on the beauty of the LORD. (Psalm 27:4)

Divine Grace.quote: By grace you have been saved through faith. (Ephesians 2:8)

Divine Presence.quote: The whole earth is full of his glory. (Isaiah 6:3)

Divine Word.quote: By the word of the LORD the heavens were made. (Psalm 33:6)

Divine Law.quote: The law of the LORD is perfect, refreshing the soul. (Psalm 19:7)

Divine Spirit.quote: The Spirit of God has made me; the breath of the Almighty gives me life. (Job 33:4)

Divine Will.quote: Not my will, but yours be done. (Luke 22:42)

Divine Nature.quote: His divine power has given us everything we need. (2 Peter 1:3)

Divine Glory.quote: The glory of the LORD filled the temple. (1 Kings 8:11)

Divine Unity.quote: Hear, O Israel: The LORD our God, the LORD is one. (Deuteronomy 6:4)

Transcendent.quote: Beyond the beyond, and yet beyond that too lies the Absolute. (Mandukya Upanishad)

Immanent.quote: Closer is He than breathing, and nearer than hands and feet. (Bhagavad Gita 18:61)

Personal.quote: I am your Father and you are My children. (Psalms 82:6)

Impersonal.quote: The Tao that can be named is not the eternal Tao. (Tao Te Ching 1)

Omnipresent.quote: Where can I flee from your presence? If I ascend to heaven, you are there. (Psalm 139:7-8)

Manifest.quote: In every age I come forth to protect the virtuous. (Bhagavad Gita 4:8)

Unmanifest.quote: No vision can grasp Him, but His grasp is over all vision. (Quran 6:103)

Absolute.quote: I am Brahman - the unchanging, infinite, immanent and transcendent reality. (Brihadaranyaka Upanishad)

Relative.quote: As many as are the forms desired by the devotee, so many forms does the Lord manifest. (Bhagavata Purana)

Universal.quote: The Self is all this: what has been, what is, what will be. (Chandogya Upanishad)

Individual.quote: The kingdom of God is within you. (Luke 17:21)

Finite.quote: Made himself nothing, taking the form of a servant. (Philippians 2:7)

Attributive.quote: The Merciful, the Compassionate, the Just, the Holy. (Quran 59:23-24)

Formless.quote: No form, no appearance, no comparison. (Heart Sutra)

Form-based.quote: I am the cosmic form, the creator of all. (Bhagavad Gita 11:8)

Eternal.quote: Before the mountains were brought forth, from everlasting to everlasting, you are God. (Psalm 90:2)

Temporal.quote: The Word became flesh and dwelt among us. (John 1:14)

Unity.quote: Hear O Israel, the Lord our God, the Lord is One. (Deuteronomy 6:4)

Multiplicity.quote: Gods are but His cosmic powers, numberless expressions of the One. (Rig Veda)

Accessible.quote: Draw near to God and He will draw near to you. (James 4:8)

Ineffable.quote: Neither words nor mind can reach That. (Taittiriya Upanishad)

Active.quote: My Father is working until now, and I am working. (John 5:17)

Passive.quote: Be still and know that I am God. (Psalm 46:10)
